section.name: Virtual Machine for Testing
section.note: Note that the version on the VM is outdated. We are working on improving Virtual Machine images.

Note that the superadmin and probably TLS server certificate have expired on the testing VM. It is possible to manually renew superadmin using the command line interface. See Renewing Superadmin in the User Guide.
section.p:
Get a feeling for, and start testing, EJBCA easily by downloading and running our EJBCAv6 VM, currently not with the latest release of EJBCA though. The VM features a full EJBCA Community v6 install, running on JBoss 7.1.1.GA and Java 7, using a MariaDB database backend. It comes with a readme file with instructions and some usage hints. The VM runs on KVM, VirtualBox and VWware®. The VM should not be used in production as admin keys are pre-generated, i.e. identical on all VMs.
Have fun!

section.name: SVN over HTTPS
section.p:
The official "secure" delivery of EJBCA source code is in the repository using svn over https. The certificate is issued to cesecore.eu, which was the consortium behind the Common Criteria certification of EJBCA.
In the SVN repository you can also find the hashes of release zip files in the history of the file doc/xdocs/site/index.xml.
If you are an Enterprise customer, you may also get an official release from PrimeKey.
